title: More IP after LVL30
body:
(First of all not sure if this is the right place to post this but it seemed most relevant. )

   After a game of league, before LVL30, you get IP and XP. After LVL30 you lose half of those rewards, because you gain the same amount of IP but no XP. What if after LVL30 the XP you would have gotten is added to the IP you gain? It might mean some people get to buy runes/rune pages faster possibly allowing them to play more roles rather than 2 at any given time. It might not be the best argument for the cause but I still think it would be a good idea to add the XP to the IP.What do you think? Pros/Cons? For/Against?

Discuss

(edit) I explained this is a reply to a comment but I think it's a good enough point to put upfront: "What I think would be nice, is for players that just got to LVL30, who might have the 2 rune pages filled out and some champs, to experiment more by getting new champs/runes/rune pages faster now that they have some idea about the game and what they want out of it."

When Riot's business model relied heavily on people that were impatient and wanted the champs without spending the time it made sense to have such low IP gains. But league has evolved from that. Now there are millions of people that play this game, an ever increasing amount of skins available for purchase, and even tickets to buy to go to LCS tournaments and Worlds. League is wildly popular and Riot will continue to make ****loads of money just by releasing a few skins.

If Riot's excuse of not increasing IP gains for an ever increasing champion pool is because they won't make enough money, then they are greedier than I would have ever expected.

I do not think Riot is that greedy, I believe they are trying to make the game to it's fullest potential and still get paid along the way. This will still happen if they increase IP gains.

Please Riot, the grinding experience needs some love.

Okay, major question and it's what's bothering me about your huge wall of text posts:

HOW CAN NEW AND BETTER IP GAIN SYSTEMS POSSIBLY SCREW OVER ANYONE?

That's the major disconnect. People that hit level 30 are still "new" players - they still haven't played ranked, probably don't have a lot of game knowledge, etc. AGAIN, I think IP gains should be increased ACROSS THE BOARD due to the increased amount of champions/runes in comparison to, say, season 1, but why does this particular idea rub you the wrong way so hard? It's perfectly logical that when you stop gaining EXP, it should be replaced with something else (instead of just getting less rewards per game forever). Sure, EXP is really just a stupid mechanic anyway (I don't even think there should be a leveling system in this game, honestly) but it's even dumber that when you hit level 30 you just stop gaining EXP and continue to gain these piddly little IP amounts. There's a problem with the IP gains as a WHOLE, but this is a SINGLE STEP that could improve them.
